info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:22PM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...St. Clair, Macomb, Wayne, Lenawee and Monroe Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy wet snow continues this afternoon into this evening. Peak snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour are possible before snow changes over to rain as temperatures rise into the mid 30s this evening. Very strong winds are expected late tonight into Saturday with gusts of up to 50 mph as arctic air filters in behind the system sending wind chill values close to zero. This will cause any residual moisture on roadways to freeze tonight, and additional snow showers will contribute to slick conditions through Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
